question.body: During an asthma attack the bronchi of the lungs constrict and become congested with mucous from bronchial glands, thus decreasing air flow. To treat the condition one would give drugs which mimic the effects of the nervous system. These drugs are also likely to the heart rate.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Parasympathetic effect is to constrict bronchioles, and thereby decrease oxygen uptake.
Correct. Sympathomimetic drugs will dilate the broinchioles.
Correct. Symtpatheticomimetic drugs will also increase heart rate – positive chronotropy.
Incorrect. Think what happens to the heart when you have a so-called “adrenalin rush.”
